title: Gareth Bale wants Real Madrid to sign Dele Alli? Transfer news and gossip from Wednesday's papers
text:
Sport Gareth Bale wants Real Madrid to sign Dele Alli? Transfer news and gossip from Wednesday's papers PLUS: Romelu Lukaku agrees a new deal at Everton and Robert Lewandowski's agent responds to Man United rumours Share   
Gareth Bale wants Real Madrid to sign Tottenham's Dele Alli as a replacement for Cristiano Ronaldo. 
According to Spanish outlet Don Balon, the Welsh star - who moved to the Bernabeu from Spurs - is keen on the England star joining him in Spain. 
But Real face competition for Alli from rivals Barcelona. 
Midfielder Alli has emerged as one of the hottest young players in world football, and the Nou Camp giants have put him top of their wanted list. 
The Spanish sides would have to cough up at least £70million if Spurs do cash in on the 20-year-old, who only cost them £5m when he signed from MK Dons in February 2015. 
Here are the rest of the transfer stories from Wednesday's Mirror and other newspapers and websites... Wednesday's gossip from other newspapers and websites Robert Lewandowski celebrates scoring at Arsenal   
Robert Lewandowski 's agent has poured cold water on rumours linking him with a move to Manchester United. (Metro) 
Real Madrid will consider a move for Eden Hazard if they sell James Rodriguez or Isco this summer. (TalkSPORT) Wednesday's stories from the Mirror (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur FC via Getty) 
Romelu Lukaku has agreed a new contract with Everton . 
But before Blues fans start celebrating, it is understood the agreement, which will run until 2022, will retain a potential exit clause for the Belgium international striker. 
Real Madrid's Isco is ready to move to Manchester City this summer . Pep Guardiola is a long term admirer of the Spain international midfielder and the Blues were keen on signing him when Manuel Pellegrini was in charge. 
Liverpool are ready to get tough with Emre Can if he continues to refuse a new contract . The Germany midfielder has been sitting on the offer a new deal since the turn of the year, but despite months of negotiations, is no closer to agreeing to extend his Anfield stay. 
Everton have joined the race for Fulham’s brilliant young left-back Ryan Sessegnon . Steve Walsh, the Toffees’ new director of football, was at Craven Cottage last Saturday to run the rule over the 16 year-old Championship defender — and Sessegnon was again outstanding in a 3-1 win over Preston. (Photo: Reuters) 
Barcelona are targeting Southampton's Cedric Soares . The £25m-rated Portugal international right-back has been hugely impressive this season. 
Torino claim England No1 keeper Joe Hart would be happy staying with them next season . Manchester City outcast Hart is on a season-long loan with the Italian side, and they are keen to make the deal permanent. 
Chelsea are set to open talks with midfield enforcer Nemanja Matic over a new contract this summer, even though they are eyeing reinforcements at his position in Monaco’s Tiemoue Bakayoko and Franck Kessie of Atalanta.
